books.title: The Clue of the New Pin
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A newspaper reporter aids the local police in investigating how a wealthy man was murdered in a room locked from the inside.

books.title: Twenty Years After
books.author: Alexandre Dumas
books.summary: Four musketeers are drawn back together by current events after many years apart, try to save Charles I from Cromwell, and are pursued by the now-grown son of a former female adversary.

books.title: Father Henson’s Story of His Own Life
books.author: Josiah Henson
books.summary: Josiah Henson’s autobiography recounts his life in slavery and his escape to freedom in Canada.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: The Mystery at Lilac Inn
books.author: Carolyn Keene
books.summary: A young amateur detective attempts to recover her friend’s stolen diamonds.

books.title: A Damsel in Distress
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A composer meets a young woman and tracks her down to a country manor, where a case of mistaken identity leads to comedy.

books.title: Six Characters in Search of an Author
books.author: Luigi Pirandello
books.summary: An absurdist comedy that contrasts illusion with reality, in which six characters arrive on a rehearsal stage filled with actors and demand the chance to speak their lines and act out the story of their lives.

books.title: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur’s Court
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: An engineer from 19th-century Connecticut is sent back in time to King Arthur’s medieval England.

books.title: The Last Post
books.author: Ford Madox Ford
books.summary: An invalid and his family reflect on recent events in the years after the close of the Great War.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Frank Belknap Long
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Frank Belknap Long, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: The Education of Henry Adams
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A prominent and caustic historian reflects on the reasons that “the more he was educated, the less he understood,” and what he believes the future holds for American society.

books.title: The Unpleasantness at the Bellona Club
books.author: Dorothy L. Sayers
books.summary: The discovery of the quiet death of an elderly man at an exclusive club leads to unexpected complications.

books.title: The New Freedom
books.author: Woodrow Wilson
books.summary: The 28th president of the United States presents the risks and opportunities for freedom and democracy through a series of campaign speeches.

books.title: Women and Economics
books.author: Charlotte Perkins Gilman
books.summary: Gilman explores the transformation of the role of women in society and the necessity for women to achieve economic independence.

books.title: Magnolia Leaves
books.author: Mary Weston Fordham
books.summary: A collection of poems by Mary Weston Fordham.

books.title: The Luck of Barry Lyndon
books.author: William Makepeace Thackeray
books.summary: A poor Irish rogue tries to win fame and fortune in the 18th-century English aristocracy.

books.title: The Moon Maid
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: A young man travels to the moon with a group of companions and discovers that it’s inhabited; in subsequent centuries, reincarnations of the same man deal with an invasion of the Earth by the malevolent inhabitants of the Moon.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Gustave Flaubert
books.summary: A collection of short stories by Gustave Flaubert.

books.title: Demian
books.author: Hermann Hesse
books.summary: A boy goes on a journey of spiritual growth.

books.title: A Negro Explorer at the North Pole
books.author: Matthew Henson
books.summary: The self-told story of the black man who accompanied Robert Peary during the first trip to the North Pole.
